### Background

`rbst` is a purely functional implementation of a balanced search tree. In addition to the normal advantages of a balanced search tree (guaranteed fast retrieval and insertion of new key-value pairs, ordered search operations), `rbst` also has the (natural in `R`) quality of non-destructive updates. 

```{r examples}
library(rbst)
example <- bst(keys = letters, values = seq_along(letters))
example

# retrieval:
example["t"]

# ordered search for keys:
keys_between(example, "f", "i")

# non-destructive insertions:
modified_example <- insert(example, "new key", 97)
contains(modified_example, "new key")
contains(example, "new key")
```
